summary: The Halt Unchecked Member Benefits with Lobbying Elimination Act (HUMBLE Act) aims to curb congressional perks and potential conflicts of interest. Key provisions include prohibiting former Members of Congress from lobbying Congress, restricting the use of official travel funds to coach-class accommodations, eliminating automatic pay adjustments, limiting benefits and services for former House Members, prohibiting House Members from owning individual stocks and serving on for-profit boards. The Act seeks to increase transparency and accountability within the legislative branch.
